intro: Helenium caspium, commonly known as the Caspian hedge parsley, is a flowering plant native to Central Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and bright yellow to orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers. Helenium caspium is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is relatively low maintenance once established.
